intro: Psilanthele grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered psilanthele, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
